title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A pig flank was found near Flowed Meadow at the Cove in Auburndale Park, Newton, possibly intended for wildlife.
Newton police, in collaboration with Mass. Environmental Police, are investigating the incident involving illegal placement of meat.
Hunting or feeding wildlife in Newton parks is prohibited under Massachusetts General Law Chapter 131, Section 59.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points despite an inefficient shooting, leading Celtics over Lakers 111-89 in Los Angeles.
Payton Pritchard continues off-bench scoring streak, delivering a standout 30-point performance against the Lakers.
LeBron James praised Jaylen Brown post-game, dismissing past tensions regarding comments about his son, Bronny James.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts closed on Monday, Feb. 23, due to a major snowstorm.
School closures include Boston, Cambridge, Quincy, and Worcester among many others in the region.
The snowstorm, referred to as a nor’easter, prompted widespread school district closures across Massachusetts.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fall River police are searching for Kyron Simmons, accused of shooting and killing a dog in early February.
Simmons, 36, faces charges including home invasion, animal cruelty, and reckless endangerment of a child, police reported.
Police issued an arrest warrant for Simmons, considered armed and dangerous, after confirming his involvement via security footage and evidence.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control reported a bobcat sighting near Deerpath Road and Route 109 in Dedham.
The town provided safety tips, including eliminating outdoor food sources and sealing crawl spaces.
Bobcat sightings are common due to their known population in Dedham and nearby towns.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora previews the Boston Red Sox 2026 lineup, featuring Roman Anthony and Trevor Story in the first two spots.
Anthony will lead off after batting .336 with 6 home runs in 27 games last season; Story follows with 25 home runs.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa rounds out the order over Marcelo Mayer, as Mayer competes for a roster spot amid past injuries.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Governor Maura Healey advises Boston residents to stay off roads due to nor'easter with expected 18-24 inches of snow.
Boston shelters open 24/7 for homeless during blizzard; Pine Street Inn provides transport, food, and warmth.
MBTA suspends ferry routes, operates trains and buses on reduced schedules; DoorDash halts service during blizzard.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman won Olympic gold with Team USA, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime in Milan.
McAvoy played a key role with 22:45 ice time, making crucial plays including a significant defensive move in the final.
The Bruins celebrated their teammates' victory from the Warrior Ice Arena, as USA Hockey achieved a historic 46-year milestone.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots own the 31st pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing on offensive linemen or edge rushers.
Draft experts like NFL's Daniel Jeremiah and Charles Davis suggest Zion Young and Max Iheanachor for Patriots.
Kenyon Sadiq, Oregon TE, noted for strong pass-catching; could address Patriots' potential future tight end gap.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey secures Olympic gold, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime in Milan, their first gold since 1980.
Jack Hughes scores the winning goal in OT, while goalie Connor Hellebuyck stops 41 shots in a standout performance.
Millis native Matt Boldy opened the scoring, giving Team USA an early lead with a goal against Canada's Jordan Binnington.
